definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: This part faces the reality that history often repeats itself.
sentences.chinese: 这部分是关于直面历史不断重演的事实。

sentences.english: Light can be trusted to curve only in a vertical plane.
sentences.chinese: 可确信光线仅在垂直面内作曲线传播。

sentences.english: Balance is found in the one who faces his guilt.
sentences.chinese: 直面愧疚，内心方获平衡。

sentences.english: Sooner or later we have to put aside our denial and face the world.
sentences.chinese: 或迟或早我们终归要抛开否认而直面这个现实的世界。

sentences.english: Part of getting better is to face the fears and sensations.
sentences.chinese: 部分患者再起作用下逐渐转好，直面恐惧和情感。

sentences.english: But this tactic fails in the face of a movement that defies such simple categorisation.
sentences.chinese: 但此策略无法直面一项反抗这般简单分类的运动。

sentences.english: When you’ve fully faced fear and experienced it, the fear will subside.
sentences.chinese: 当你直面恐惧，适应它，恐惧就会平息下来。

sentences.english: You are now in the boxing ring, dealing directly with challenges, and life may feel quite intense.
sentences.chinese: 似乎正在拳击赛中，直面挑战，也许生会显得很紧张。

sentences.english: The soldiers are face their difficulties directly without fear.
sentences.chinese: 战士们直面困难，不畏艰险。

sentences.english: Ink art bears the cultural gene that is hugely endowed and heavily challenged, designating it to face the fact.
sentences.chinese: 水墨以其文化基因的优越和沉重，更须直面这个现实。

sentences.english: Don’t go straight into politics, because no one will be particularly interested.
sentences.chinese: 不要直面政治界，因为没人会特别感兴趣。

sentences.english: At the same time don’t overprotect him from facing his fear.
sentences.chinese: 同时，不要过分地保护他而不让他去直面恐惧。

sentences.english: This paper introduces a planar motion mechanism(PMM) in vertical plane of SJTU.
sentences.chinese: 本文介绍了上海交通大学研制的垂直面平面运动机构。

sentences.english: But Eduardo seemed ready to confront reality.
sentences.chinese: 但爱德华多似乎做好了直面现实的准备。

sentences.english: They face up to the reality of human life, and move freely between the worlds of light and shade.
sentences.chinese: 他们直面人间的一切，自由地往来于明暗之间。

sentences.english: It brings us nose-to-nose with what Buddha called the "suchness" of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 它使我们能够直面佛陀所云的生活的“本真”。

definition: to face squarely/to meet head on/to face up to
to dare to/to be brave enough to
to have the courage to do sth/to dare to/bold in
to shun/to avoid (sb)/to skirt/to evade (an issue)/to step back/to withdraw/to recuse (a judge etc)
variant of 迴避|回避[hui2 bi4]
